intro: Ardisia tonii, commonly known as the Philippine beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its striking purple berries that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and dark green, while its flowers are small and white, often arranged in clusters. The berries are not only ornamental but also attract birds, aiding in seed dispersal.
